comment.text: Downloaded via koji. Is working fine for me.

This is an urgent security update with critical flaws, in one of the most popular and used software packages that processes large amounts of remote and varied internet data, and after submission to Bodhi over two days ago, it has not even managed to make it yet to the testing repository (where people can get it easily without going through the manual process of downloading from Koji)!! Seriously?!?

How about any package security update jumps to the top of the queue, and lands in testing within an hour after submission to Bodhi (subject it to passing any necessary tests)??

This is an urgent security update with critical flaws, in one of the most popular and used software packages that processes large amounts of remote and varied internet data, and after submission to Bodhi over two days ago, it has not even managed to make it yet to the testing repository (where people can get it easily without going through the manual process of downloading from Koji)!! Seriously?!?

How about any package security update jumps to the top of the queue, and lands in testing within an hour after submission to Bodhi (subject it to passing any necessary tests)??

Did you see the message:  **```This update has been submitted for stable by bodhi.```**? It means that is it going to stable directly and will skip ```testing```.

Moreover, you can get this package from bodhi almost as easy as using `dnf --enablerepo=updates-testing`:

    bodhi updates download --updateid FEDORA-2018-6c0aeafdfa && sudo dnf update ./firefox

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
Firefox 62.0.3 got released. According to the changelog, it is including a security fix.

Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
62.0.3

Actual results:
62.0.2 is available in the stable repos

Expected results:
62.0.3 should be available

Additional info:
Release notes:
https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/62.0.3/releasenotes/

- Fixed hangs on macOS Mojave (10.14) when various dialog windows (upload, download, print, etc) are activated (bug 1489785)
- Fixed playback of some encrypted video streams on macOS (bug 1491940)
- Various security fixes


Security advisory:
https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/security/known-vulnerabilities/firefox/#firefox62.0.3
(it is not yet released. this typically takes some hours, after they pushed the version to the update servers)

firefox-62.0.3-1.fc28 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 28. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2018-6c0aeafdfa
firefox-62.0.3-1.fc28 has been pushed to the Fedora 28 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

firefox-62.0.3-1.fc27 has been pushed to the Fedora 27 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for
instructions on how to install test updates.
You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2018-2ea4a2cb8b

firefox-62.0.3-1.fc29 has been pushed to the Fedora 29 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
firefox-62.0.3-2.fc27 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 27. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2018-58ae5c6d28

comments.text: This update has been submitted for testing by stransky.
This update has been submitted for stable by bodhi.
Downloaded via koji. Is working fine for me.

This is an urgent security update with critical flaws, in one of the most popular and used software packages that processes large amounts of remote and varied internet data, and after submission to Bodhi over two days ago, it has not even managed to make it yet to the testing repository (where people can get it easily without going through the manual process of downloading from Koji)!! Seriously?!?

How about any package security update jumps to the top of the queue, and lands in testing within an hour after submission to Bodhi (subject it to passing any necessary tests)??

Did you see the message:  **```This update has been submitted for stable by bodhi.```**? It means that is it going to stable directly and will skip ```testing```.

Moreover, you can get this package from bodhi almost as easy as using `dnf --enablerepo=updates-testing`:

    bodhi updates download --updateid FEDORA-2018-6c0aeafdfa && sudo dnf update ./firefox
This update has been pushed to stable.

notes:
* Update to new version (62.0.3)
* More info at https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/62.0.3/releasenotes/
